intro: Moraea sertula, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea sertula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
